evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: COUNT I (Non-statutory review of official and agency action) 84. Plaintiffs have a non‑statutory right of action to enjoin and declare unlawful official action that is ultra vires. 85. Members of the Executive Branch have only those powers conferred on them by the Constitution and federal statutes. 86. Federal legislation must be passed by both chambers of Congress before it may be presented to the President, and, if signed, become law. U.S. Const., art. I. Members of the Executive Branch have no authority under the Constitution to amend statutes unilaterally. 87. IES and the National Education Centers were established by statute and charged with specific responsibilities. IES and the National Education Centers can be eliminated only by a statute enacted by Congress. 88.

extracted.value: COUNT I – Non‑statutory review of official and agency action

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: COUNT II (Administrative Procedure Act – Contrary to Law – Violation of Education Sciences Reform Act and Higher Education Opportunity Act) 89. The APA directs courts to hold unlawful and set aside agency actions that are not in accordance with law. 5 U.S.C. § 706(2)(A). 90. Defendants’ decision to end the programs and activities of IES, and their mass cancellation of contracts, large‑scale reduction‑in‑force, and termination of remote restricted data use licenses are final agency actions.

extracted.value: COUNT II – Administrative Procedure Act – Contrary to Law – Violation of Education Sciences Reform Act and Higher Education Opportunity Act

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: COUNT III (Administrative Procedure Act – Arbitrary and Capricious) 100. The APA directs courts to hold unlawful and set aside agency actions that are found to be arbitrary and capricious. 5 U.S.C. § 706(2)(A). 101. Defendants have offered no reasoned explanation for their actions and have failed to account for the interests of researchers, nonprofit organizations, institutions, and other stakeholders that benefit from a functioning IES and the work it performs, including via the ability to access and use data.

extracted.value: COUNT III – Administrative Procedure Act – Arbitrary and Capricious

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: COUNT IV (Administrative Procedure Act – Contrary to Law – Impoundment Control Act) 103. The APA directs courts to hold unlawful and set aside agency actions that are not in accordance with law. 5 U.S.C. § 706(2)(A). 104. The Impoundment Control Act requires the executive to make appropriated funds “available for obligation” unless the President sends a special message to Congress detailing a request to rescind or reserve funds and Congress then passes a recission bill rescinding the funding. 2 U.S.C. § 683.

extracted.value: COUNT IV – Administrative Procedure Act – Contrary to Law – Impoundment Control Act

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: (A) Declare that Defendants’ actions terminating IES’s performance of statutorily mandated activities and impounding funds that IES would otherwise use to pay salaries, operating costs, and contract and grant obligations are unlawful;

extracted.value: Declare that Defendants’ actions terminating IES’s performance of statutorily mandated activities and impounding funds that IES would otherwise use to pay salaries, operating costs, and contract and grant obligations are unlawful.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: (B) Declare unlawful and set aside Defendants’ mass termination of contracts, reduction in force, and termination of remote restricted-use data licenses, as arbitrary, capricious, an abuse of discretion, or otherwise not in accordance with law under 5 U.S.C. § 706(2)(A);

extracted.value: Declare unlawful and set aside Defendants’ mass termination of contracts, reduction in force, and termination of remote restricted-use data licenses, as arbitrary, capricious, an abuse of discretion, or otherwise not in accordance with law under 5 U.S.C. § 706(2)(A).

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: (C) Order Defendants to take steps to restore terminated contracts that execute statutorily mandated tasks or enable the agency to do so;

extracted.value: Order Defendants to take steps to restore terminated contracts that execute statutorily mandated tasks or enable the agency to do so.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: (D) Vacate any RIF as to IES employees necessary to perform the agency’s statutory functions;

extracted.value: Vacate any RIF as to IES employees necessary to perform the agency’s statutory functions.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: (E) Vacate the decision to terminate all remote restricted-use data licenses;

extracted.value: Vacate the decision to terminate all remote restricted-use data licenses.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: (F) Enjoin Defendants from taking any further steps that hinder IES’s ability to perform its statutorily mandated tasks;

extracted.value: Enjoin Defendants from taking any further steps that hinder IES’s ability to perform its statutorily mandated tasks.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: (G) Issue a temporary restraining order and preliminary injunction directing Defendants to cease immediately actions to cease IES’s operations;

extracted.value: Issue a temporary restraining order and preliminary injunction directing Defendants to cease immediately actions to cease IES’s operations.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: (H) Award Plaintiffs their costs, reasonable attorney’s fees, and other disbursements as appropriate;

extracted.value: Award Plaintiffs their costs, reasonable attorney’s fees, and other disbursements as appropriate.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: (I) Grant such other relief as the Court deems necessary, just, and proper.

extracted.value: Grant such other relief as the Court deems necessary, just, and proper.
